Name: Isaiah Taylor
POS: Isaiah Taylor (eye bruise) is expected to miss "a few games."

Name: Luke Babbitt
POS: Luke Babbitt (back) and Mike Muscala (ankle) are questionable for Saturday's game against the Celtics.

Name: Mike Muscala
POS: Mike Muscala (ankle) said he will be available to play Saturday vs. the Celtics.

Name: DeAndre Bembry
POS: DeAndre Bembry (wrist) told reporters he is ready to play but is waiting for clearance from the Hawks training staff.

Name: D'Angelo Russell
POS: D'Angelo Russell underwent successful arthroscopic knee surgery on Friday to remove loose bodies.

Name: Jeremy Lin
POS: The Nets announced that Jeremy Lin had successful surgery Friday morning to repair the ruptured patella tendon in his right knee and will miss the rest of the season.

Name: Gordon Hayward
POS: Gordan Hayward (leg) has shed his hard cast and is now in a walking boot.

Name: Julyan Stone
POS: Julyan Stone will miss the next 4-6 weeks with a Grade 2 left hamstring strain.

Name: David Nwaba
POS: David Nwaba (ankle) is targeting a return on Sunday.

Name: Nikola Mirotic
POS: Nikola Mirotic (face) won't travel with the Bulls on their four-game road trip that begins on Sunday.

Name: Cameron Payne
POS: Cameron Payne (foot) is making progress and will be re-evaluated in three weeks.

Name: Zach LaVine
POS: Zach LaVine (knee) could be cleared for full contact as soon as Nov. 20.

Name: Iman Shumpert
POS: Iman Shumpert (knee) went scoreless with one rebound, one assist, one steal and one blocked shot across 11 minutes before checking out of Friday's win against the Clippers.

Name: Derrick Rose
POS: Derrick Rose (ankle) will miss at least the next two weeks.

Name: Tristan Thompson
POS: The Cavaliers announced on Thursday that Tristan Thompson will miss 3-4 weeks with a left calf strain.

Name: Isaiah Thomas
POS: Isaiah Thomas (hip) said he is "getting closer to being back on the floor and being able to play."

Name: Dorian Finney-Smith
POS: Rick Carlisle said that Dorian Finney-Smith (knee) "will be out a while."

Name: Seth Curry
POS: Seth Curry (leg) is listed as out for Friday's game vs. the Wolves.

POS: Josh McRoberts (lower extremity injury) is listed as out in the game notes for Wednesday's game vs. Memphis.

POS: Tyler Lydon is dealing with a sprained ankle.

Name: Jon Leuer
POS: Jon Leuer (ankle) is inactive for Friday against the Pacers.

POS: Patrick Beverley (knee) is listed as doubtful for Saturday's game vs. the Hornets.

POS: Danilo Gallinari (strained left glute) is listed as out for Saturday's game vs. the Hornets.

Name: Wayne Selden

Name: Rodney McGruder
POS: Rodney McGruder underwent successful surgery on Tuesday to repair a stress fracture in his left tibia, and he's expected to begin rehab in one week.

Name: Cole Aldrich
POS: Cole Aldrich (ankle) will be available to play against the Spurs on Wednesday.

Name: Justin Patton
POS: Tom Thibodeau said Justin Patton (foot) is progressing as expected, but he will not rush the rehab process.

Name: Matthew Dellavedova

POS: Gery Woelfel of The Journal Times said Jabari Parker (knee) "already appears to be game ready."

POS: Tony Allen (knee) will not play on Friday vs. the Nuggets.

POS: Alexis Ajinca underwent successful bilateral knee injections on Thursday and is expected to miss 4-6 weeks.

Name: Frank Jackson
POS: Frank Jackson (foot) underwent successful surgery on Friday to repair a fifth metatarsal fracture in his right foot.

POS: Ron Baker (shoulder) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. Toronto.

POS: Thabo Sefolosha (right knee soreness) will not play on Friday vs. the Nets.

POS: Ricky Rubio (Achilles soreness) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Nets.

POS: Dante Exum underwent a successful procedure Tuesday morning to stabilize the AC joint in his left shoulder.
